verses.roman:
kintu anurāgī lokera svabhāva eka haya
iṣṭa nā pāile nija prāṇa se chāḍaya

synonyms: kintu—still; anurāgī—affectionate; lokera—of the people; svabhāva—nature; eka—one; haya—there is; iṣṭa—desirable; nā pāile—without getting; nija—own; prāṇa—life; se—he; chāḍaya—gives up.
translation: "Still, isn't it the nature of an attached man to give up his life if he does not attain his desired object?
